title: Weekend quake gauged 3.6
author: Seattle Times Staff: Seattle Times News Services
text: TACOMA - A small earthquake that rattled Pierce County over the weekend was normal for the region and almost identical to one reported a year ago in the same place, a spokesman at the University of Washington's seismology lab said.     The quake, felt by some area residents just before midnight Friday, was of magnitude 3.6 - at the very low end of temblors that can be felt by people nearby, scientists say. It was followed by two small aftershocks. No injuries or property damage were reported.     The UW lab said the quake occurred at 11:43 p.m. and was centered about 10 miles west of Mount Rainier and about 5.5 miles  underground.
